filmography.title: The Fortune Cookie
filmography.role_description: A crooked, ambulance-chasing lawyer who convinces his brother-in-law to fake a serious injury for a massive insurance payout.
filmography.plot: After a cameraman is slightly injured during a football game, his scheming lawyer brother-in-law persuades him to feign paralysis to win a huge settlement.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actor; Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor – Comedy or Musical

filmography.title: The Odd Couple
filmography.role_description: A slovenly, carefree sportswriter whose life is turned upside down when his neurotic, obsessively neat friend moves in.
filmography.plot: Two friends try to share an apartment, but their ideas of housekeeping and lifestyles are as different as night and day.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor – Comedy or Musical; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Laughs (#17)

filmography.title: The Bad News Bears
filmography.role_description: A grumbling, beer-swilling former minor league pitcher who reluctantly coaches a team of hopeless misfits in a competitive Little League.
filmography.plot: An aging, down-on-his-luck ex-minor leaguer coaches a team of misfits in an ultra-competitive California Little League.

filmography.title: Charade
filmography.role_description: A CIA administrator who guides a widow through a dangerous web of deceit in Paris, though his true motives remain murky.
filmography.plot: Romance and suspense ensue in Paris as a woman is pursued by several men who want a fortune her murdered husband had stolen. Who can she trust?
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nominated – Best Foreign Actor (Nomination shared with other films)

filmography.title: The Taking of Pelham One Two Three
filmography.role_description: A weary, sardonic New York City transit police lieutenant who must negotiate with a group of ruthless hijackers holding a subway train for ransom.
filmography.plot: In New York, armed men hijack a subway car and demand a ransom for the passengers. Even if it's paid, how could they get away?
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Nominated – Best Actor; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Thrills (#95)

filmography.title: A Face in the Crowd
filmography.role_description: A cynical television writer who witnesses the rise of a populist entertainer and becomes the moral conscience of the story.
filmography.plot: An Arkansas drifter becomes an overnight media sensation. As he becomes drunken with fame and power, he will betray the people who made him an icon.
filmography.awards: None (Film selected for National Film Registry)

filmography.title: Charley Varrick
filmography.role_description: A former stunt pilot turned crop duster and small-time bank robber who accidentally steals money belonging to the Mob.
filmography.plot: A man robs a bank in a small town with his wife and a friend, only to discover they got away with a lot more money than they expected—Mob money.

filmography.title: The Sunshine Boys
filmography.role_description: A bitter, aging vaudevillian who reluctantly reunites with his former partner for a TV special despite their decades-long feud.
filmography.plot: A vaudeville duo agrees to reunite for a TV special, but it turns out they can't stand each other.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor – Comedy or Musical; BAFTA: Nominated – Best Actor

filmography.title: Kotch
filmography.role_description: An elderly man who refuses to be put out to pasture in a nursing home and instead strikes out on a road trip, befriending a pregnant teenager.
filmography.plot: A retired salesman fights to retain his independence and dignity when his son and daughter-in-law try to put him in a retirement home.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor – Comedy or Musical

filmography.title: Grumpy Old Men
filmography.role_description: A lifelong curmudgeon who engages in a relentless prank war with his neighbor and rival, played by Jack Lemmon.
filmography.plot: A lifelong feud between two neighbors since childhood only gets worse when a new female neighbor moves across the street.

filmography.title: A New Leaf
filmography.role_description: A bankrupt playboy who plans to marry a wealthy, clumsy woman for her money and then murder her, only to find himself developing feelings for her.
filmography.plot: A spoiled heir who has squandered his fortune must find a rich woman to support his lifestyle, but his plan to marry and murder hits a snag.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor – Comedy or Musical

filmography.title: Hopscotch
filmography.role_description: A brilliant but bored CIA field operative who is demoted to a desk job and decides to write a tell-all memoir to expose the agency's incompetence.
filmography.plot: A CIA agent, tired of his incompetent boss, decides to retire and write a memoir exposing the agency's secrets, leading to a global chase.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor – Comedy or Musical

filmography.title: Fail Safe
filmography.role_description: A cold, calculating civilian defense analyst who argues that nuclear war is winnable, serving as a chilling contrast to the unfolding disaster.
filmography.plot: A technical malfunction sends American planes to Moscow to deliver a nuclear attack, forcing the US President to make a desperate decision to avoid total annihilation.

filmography.title: Cactus Flower
filmography.role_description: A dentist who lies to his young girlfriend about being married to avoid commitment, then recruits his nurse to pose as his wife.
filmography.plot: A dentist pretends to be married to keep his affair with a younger woman light, but when she demands to meet his wife, he recruits his nurse to play the part.

filmography.title: The Front Page
filmography.role_description: A ruthless, manipulative newspaper editor who will stop at nothing to keep his star reporter from quitting on the eve of a big execution.
filmography.plot: A newspaper editor uses every trick in the book to keep his ace reporter from retiring to get married.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor – Comedy or Musical

filmography.title: Lonely Are the Brave
filmography.role_description: A sympathetic modern-day sheriff who reluctantly hunts down a cowboy fugitive he secretly respects.
filmography.plot: A defiant cowboy gets himself thrown into jail to help a friend break out, then finds himself hunted by the law and a modern world he doesn't fit into.

filmography.title: Pete 'n' Tillie
filmography.role_description: A witty, cynical bachelor who enters into a complex marriage with a reserved woman, navigating love, infidelity, and tragedy.
filmography.plot: A relaxed bachelor and a serious woman marry in their middle years and face the challenges of life, including the death of their son.
filmography.awards: BAFTA: Win – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor – Comedy or Musical

filmography.title: King Creole
filmography.role_description: A menacing local mob boss who tries to control a young singer's career and personal life in New Orleans.
filmography.plot: A young man in New Orleans gets mixed up with a local gangster and his moll while trying to make it as a singer.

filmography.title: JFK
filmography.role_description: A cameo role as the real-life Senator who expresses doubts about the Warren Commission to Jim Garrison.
filmography.plot: New Orleans District Attorney Jim Garrison discovers there's more to the Kennedy assassination than the official story.

filmography.title: California Suite
filmography.role_description: A faithful husband who panics when he wakes up with a prostitute in his hotel room just before his wife arrives.
filmography.plot: Four stories of guests at the Beverly Hills Hotel, including a man trying to hide an unconscious woman from his wife.
filmography.awards: None (Maggie Smith won Oscar for this film)

filmography.title: Hello, Dolly!
filmography.role_description: A wealthy, grumpy "half-a-millionaire" merchant in Yonkers who travels to New York to find a wife, only to be pursued by the matchmaker Dolly Levi.
filmography.plot: Matchmaker Dolly Levi travels to Yonkers to find a partner for 'half-a-millionaire' Horace Vandergelder, convincing his niece, his niece's intended, and his two clerks to travel to New York City along with her.

filmography.title: Plaza Suite
filmography.role: Sam Nash / Jesse Kiplinger / Roy Hubley
filmography.role_description: Matthau plays three distinct roles in three acts: an overworked businessman, a famous Hollywood producer, and a father trying to get his daughter out of a bathroom on her wedding day.
filmography.plot: Three vignettes, each set in the same room of the Plaza Hotel, featuring different characters facing relationship crises.

filmography.title: The Laughing Policeman
filmography.role_description: A grim San Francisco detective who investigates the machine-gun massacre of a bus full of passengers, one of whom was his partner.
filmography.plot: A police detective searches for the madman who gunned down a busload of people in San Francisco.

filmography.title: Bigger Than Life
filmography.role_description: A fellow teacher and friend who witnesses the protagonist's descent into drug-induced madness.
filmography.plot: A schoolteacher becomes addicted to a cortisone drug that threatens to destroy his life and family.

filmography.title: Mirage
filmography.role_description: An amateurish private investigator who helps a man suffering from amnesia discover his identity.
filmography.plot: An accountant suffers from amnesia and is pursued by unknown men while trying to figure out why everyone wants him dead.

filmography.title: Dennis the Menace
filmography.role_description: The quintessential grumpy neighbor who just wants peace and quiet but is constantly tormented by the well-meaning but disastrous Dennis.
filmography.plot: When his parents have to go out of town, Dennis stays with Mr. and Mrs. Wilson, driving Mr. Wilson crazy.
